reviews.text: Went with my 9 yo daughter for a quick getaway - stayed there because there was nothing available where we usually stay at the Moorings Village in Islamorada, which is probably the nicest place to stay in the Keys.
reviews.title: some pros some cons
nice hotel - good pools
reviews.text: Anyway, they've done a nice job on renovations completed to date. We stayed in the main building, 1/2 of which was just redone, which is why I was surprised to see a bunch of carpet stains on the floor of our "oceanfront" room. With regard to the view, seeing that I paid extra for it, if you went out on the balcony and turned right and looked past the pool and then through the trees, you could sort of see a part of the ocean; however, the primary view from our room was of the roof of the building where they serve breakfast, which was very disappointing. Otherwise, the room was nice, bathrooms very nice, nice products supplied, and other than the stained carpet, the room was clean. However, room service trays from other rooms sat out on the floor of the hallway for most of the day and night, which was strange considering that I saw housekeeping walk up and down the floor throughout the day. Not sure why no one picked up dirty plates and cups left out in the hall, which was really kind of gross and strange that they all kept walking right by them...

reviews.title: Give it Time
reviews.text: Which leads to what I found to be the resort's main problem - service. When dealing with the staff, it was almost like there was an underlying attitude, and that the'd only do what was asked of them with some proding - except that when Im on vacation - especially in the laid back keys - i don't want to be proding anyone. Here are a some examples:

reviews.title: Love love love it!!!
reviews.text: 1. Our room wasn't ready when we got there, so they said they'd call when it was, except they never did. I only found out that our room was ready when I went back to the front desk 3 hours later to see what was up, and they immediately became defensive and told me that someone had called me on my cell, which clearly they didn't, as there were no missed calls or messages. Not a biggie, but why make up that they called when they didn't? I hate that.

reviews.title: What a nice surprise....
reviews.text: 2. On two occassions, there were no towels available at the pool. One time they said that they'd bring me a few when they got a bunch back from the laundry, which they never did. Also not a biggie, but, again, kind of annoying.

My family and I have been visiting there for years now, and we go at least 4 times a year. Hawks Cay resort use to be a friendly relaxing resort that welcomed kids and made you feel that you were in paradise. Now, under the new ownership, all the new employess act as if your a bother and are not helpful but very snobby. The main hotel made you feel so at ease with it's tropical decor,caribbean music, friendly staff, and kids could be kids. Under the new management, it's all changed. The hotel is now decorated very cold- it reminds me of an airport with alot of chairs and a stand up bar with no chairs. That's the lobby! No more comfy chairs, sweet smells of the bakery that once was there, the kids shop is now gone and so is the library and play room. It's icy cold with very bad attitude everywhere you go. Don't plan on sleeping in in the morning, construction starts at 7 am sharp- really loud!!! It's very sad that such a great family place that had so much history with presidents has now been replaced by the worst resort I've ever been to. For those of you who have visited before, the Truman bar, with all it's pictures, history, and memorabilia is no longer called that- they just did away with all of the great USA history :( They're not very American!!!
reviews.title: What a Dissappointment!!!

likes.liked: — Water views, but you can get that anywhere in the keys
likes.disliked: — hated the new resort and the employees are very rude and snobby

reviews.text: We spent a week there with our 3 kids (6, 9, 12) mid-march. Our idea of a relaxing vacation is when everyone can take the day at their own pace while finding fun things to do. Hawk's Cay definitely made that possible. The Indies Club was my kids' favorite destination and my kids usually hate those resort kid camps. All the counselors (Brett being their favorite) really went out of their way to make it fun for the 2 younger ones, while the 12 yr old enjoyed the basketball court and the phenomenal arcade/game room. We particularly appreciated when one night (after trying to go to Key West for dinner and had to turn back due to an accident which closed the highway) we arrived at the hotel bar at 10pm just after the kitchen at the restaurants had already closed looking for a bite and Scot, working at the bar went to the back and managed to pull together some tapas like plates which were quite tasty and satisfying. Though this was not the usual fare the bar served, he understood our needs at the moment and rather than give what would be the usual "sorry the kichen is closed" he turned our evening around. That is what I call great service. Between the well-appointed villas on lovely grounds (we had beautiful water views from our spacious verandas), the 3 beautiful pools (one which is for grown ups only if you'd prefer to escape from kids & relax peacefully by the pool) and every possible activity you can imagine offered right at the resort (spa, tennis, fishing, dolphins, sailing, jetskiing, snooba/scuba, etc) you'd never need to leave the resort during your whole stay. But if you want to explore, you're less than 1 hr drive to Key West and 2hrs to Miami. We left Hawks Cay a happy and relaxed family.
reviews.title: Something for everyone

reviews.text: I found the resort to be a lovely spot to take my family. Definitely not for the spring break party animals that hit Key West. My kids had a great time in the new pool and salt water lagoon. Our room was fresh and I love the spa. I don't even mind showing my room key if it leaves me a free chair at the pool and keeps the party crashers out. Seems like the new management is trying to bring this hotel up a notch. We will be back.
reviews.title: Lovely Spot
The Worst!
reviews.text: This hotel is terrible. I will give them as much time as the GM gave me. Everything about it was horrible. The service the food the noise.............
Do yourself a favor and stay away!
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

likes.disliked: — Nothing- frankly it was really ideal.

reviews.text: ..we stayed in one of the 3 bedroom villas that was spectacular...plenty of room to spread out (with 4 kids that is a big plus) and it was one of the nicest places we ever stayed...the kitchen and washer/dryer were a big plus...the resort property itself was gorgeous, with plenty of things for the kids to do (from the "pirate pool" to the lagoon to just fishing off the dock in our backyard of the villa)...throw in watersports, offshore fishing that is only a 1/2 hour ride out at best, snorkelling, and just being lazy by what must be the best-temperature swimming pools anywhere, and you will have a great family vacation...
reviews.title: beautiful resort and property with lots of fun for the entire family...

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights with our two daughters in April 09 - and it really is paradise. The resort is beautiful and the staff couldn't do enough for us. We stayed in a two bed villa which was small but perfectly formed - although housekeeping forgot to clean twice and left a bag of rubbish hanging off our fence for 3 days! The two restaurants on site are pricey (as is everything about this resort) and one is not suitable for children. The reception staff were great though and recommended Sparkeys restaurant 5 mins drive away which was fantastic - but get there early as they don't take reservations. I would also highly recommend Leigh Annes Coffee House for the best milkshakes and home made cakes. You cannot stay at this resort without visiting The Dolphin Research Centre or Turtle Hospital both of which were wonderful. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends - but just tell them to save up beforehand!
reviews.title: Bliss, expensive, but bliss nonetheless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were only at the Hawks Cay Resort in the Middle Keys for a few days but we instantly knew when we first arrived we had found the best resort in the Florida Keys. The Keys have long been our favorite vacation destination but the past several years has seen Key West overrun with cruise ships and tourists all seeking the “Key West” experience that is nearly gone. But Hawks Cay is the perfect resort where the laid-back, casual Keys lifestyle still thrives. From the moment we walked into the beautiful lobby we knew. The staff is very friendly and always made us feel welcomed. The hotel rooms are very roomy with incredible bathrooms with great walk-in showers. The grounds are simply beautiful and we really enjoy being able to relax at the Tranquility Pool, which is adults only. We only noticed two drawbacks, which were relatively minor. Even though the cable television offers many channels, there are no in-room, on-demand movies for purchase. So next time we’ll bring out portable DVD player to hook into the flat panel television. Also, room service ends at 10pm so we had to plan ahead for a late-night snack. All in all, I would recommend Hawks Cay to any of my family and personal friends.
reviews.title: The Perfect Florida Keys Experience

reviews.text: If anyone is looking for a FANTASTIC resort for the entire family, Hawks Cay in the Florida Keys is the place to go. When entering the resort, one notices a sign that reads, "Welcome to Paradise." -That's a tall order, and they don't disappoint!
reviews.title: Paradise for the whole family!

reviews.text: We traveled with another family so we were 5 adults and 6 children. The staff were super friendly and helpful, and the location is spectacular. There are 5 or 6 great pools plus a man-made lagoon, complete with kayaks and a floating dock in the middle to swim out to. They also have a Pirate Ship wading pool for the very young with shooting canons, water slides, etc. - The resort provides a 1/2 day camp which is totally supervised and fantastic, but our children didn't partake. They were entertained day in and day out with fantastic activities and contests, pick-up sports, arts and crafts, night time movies by the pool, and more. It is such a safe and enclosed environment that we felt totally comfortable relaxing by the pools, sipping cocktails, while our kids explored all the great activities.
reviews.title: High quality and expensive resort lacking in a few areas. Generally v good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to spend a week in the Keys and decided that a nice hotel resort, half way down the chain of islands, was the perfect place. Hawks Cay is really nice as a resort, lots of facilities (including spa, gym and several pools) and it is equidistant from Key Lago and Key West and about two and a half hour drive from Miami. The hotel is clean, service is good although do not expect any particularly personal touches that you might find in smaller hotels. The staff all smile but there is a very USA Have a Nice Day feel to the place. Some other reviews mention that there are lots of families and kids. They are right and in during the day the main pool tended to turn into a playground. But there is an adults only pool and plenty of other stuff to do in the Keys. Nearby is the Dolphin Research Centre where you can swim with dolphins. The hotel itself has a dolphin enclosure but its pretty small and we were not sure how we felt about keeping such beautiful creatures closed in such as small area.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location...but be prepared to pay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside to the stay was the weather. We were counting on doing lots of water sports but the neverending south easterly wind stopped everything for an entire week!
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other downside to the hotel is the extra costs that you run up in a week. They make you pay a daily fee of 20 dollars for various services such as the vallet parking and towels for the pool. This is all well and good but the hotel itself is expensive and one would therefore expect such luxuries to be included. The cocktails and bar snacks are nice but costly for what they are the the Alba Restaraunt was very expensive for pretty average, uninspiring food. We soon realised that you could eat much better elsewhere in the Keys and for less money. Also take into account that I am a Brit from London, writing at a time when the pound dollar exchange does not work in my favour....for Americans, the prices might not seem so high.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service

reviews.text: That said we had a lovely time and would go back for a week of relaxation and sun. Given that a number of the hotels and resorts look slightly run down, inkeeping with the feel of the Keys, Hawks Cay is a touch of luxury.
reviews.title: We will recommend it to friends and family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent the weekend here and loved it! The lobby and rooms are gorgeous. Beautiful furniture and colors. The views here are amazing. We spent a lot of time at the adult-only pool. They have these great cabanas to sit in when the sun gets too hot. I felt so spoiled when the waiters came by and served me drinks! The service was very good, and I especillay loved it when we first got to the hotel and the bellman took our luggage, offered us some cold bottles of water and said "Welcome Home." There's so much to do here that I will definitely come back again. And we LOVED swimming with the dolphins!
reviews.title: Impersonal and a massively disappointing place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read some of the reviews and was quite suprised that there so many negative comments. My husband and I had just come from the Eden Rock Resort on Miami Beach ( which was lovely!), and were very happy with our stay at Hawks Cay. The price at Hawk's Cay was half the price, for a nicer room. They had everything you could want at the resort, with exception of free coffee/tea in the a.m. I loved the idea of an adults only pool. Our service was fine, and the room beautiful.
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.text: I was misled on the phone while making my reservation. I was told the pool bar was right behind my room. There is no "pool bar". The pool was 4 blocks from my room. We had to drive back and forth to the pool because the phones were not working so we could not get a shuttle. The phone did not work, the remote control did not work, the sliding doors were off track, the curtains were falling from the rod, no bathroom on the first floor. I asked for a handicapped room, did not get one. Was told the manager would return my call, that did not happen. The seagulls were bathing in the pool, that really made me want to jump right in with their poo. The parking was horrible. I have stayed at tiny hotels that were much more convenient and pleasant. I have stayed at resorts that make this look.........poor. It was an expensive waste of money. Don't do it, it looks great on their web site, not in person. Our neighbors were very loud, all night!
reviews.title: never again

reviews.text: We just got back from seven days at this resort. We went with two other families. It was 6 adults and 7 children. We stayed in the main hotel with a beautiful room over looking the pool, lagoon, and ocean. The room was beautifuly updated and wonderfully convenient to pools, restaurants etc. Our friends stayed in the villas, both beautiful with great views. I read some of the negative reviews before I left, but I am happy to say that there was nothing negative about this resort. I checked in about an hour and a half before check in time. The room was not ready, but the front desk took my cell number and said they would call when it was ready. I don't think I was sitting by the pool for more than 15 minutes when the phone rang and I went and picked up the key. The staff, from check-in to the pool service to the restaurants to the person who drove us around in the golf cart could not have been nicer. The kids had a ball in the wonderfully heated pool all week. This is a great family resort.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort !

reviews.text: I just returned and have nothing, but good things to say about Hawks. This was my second visit and each time I had a blast. I stayed in the villas, which are amazing. The resort has anything you or your family could want. The hotel is gorgeous to start. It has recently been redone and offers views of the water on almost every side. The villas were perfect for us because we were traveling with friends and a baby. It allowed us to hang with friends just like we were at home...except in the amazing keys! It also was great because we were able to have some food for cooking or snacking without having to go to a crowded restaurant. The service at Hawks was top notch! Sitting by the pool, we never needed to get up to get a drink or food, there were staff constantly cruising the pool areas. I was also able to get in a yoga session one morning set up through the spa and fitness center. It was in an area that was secluded and peaceful, perfect! Hawks is perfect for a couple or family. Between the 5 or 6 pools, including the kid heaven pirate pool, or the marina, or lovely views of all the homes and boats of Duck Key, everyone is sure to find something they love! I can't wait to go back! GO HAWKS!
reviews.title: a little piece of heaven

reviews.text: I went there with the preconception of the facility being a little dated and still under construction.However, that was definitely not the case.
reviews.title: EASTER PLEASURES

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I intended to use Hawks Cay as a base to explore snorkeling in the area. However, after arriving we realized that it is actually quite a drive to reach anything else. So, we attempted to look into their activitiesbut quickly found that they were extremely overpriced...Snorkeling = $60, Meet the Dolphins = $60pp, Breakfast buffet for two w/ tip = $60. I guess if you have a lot of $ to spend then this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Extended weekend in the Keys

reviews.text: As for the resort itself, it is a nice place but it wasnt as clean as i prefer. There was mildew in our shower and on the shower curtain.
reviews.title: A hidden Gem for families

reviews.text: We were never given a resort map or any real info so a lot of the resort was left unknown to us. It seemed that the families with kids were having a good time, but again, be sure to have a chunk of $ to spend if you want to really enjoy yourself.
reviews.title: Sure glad I didn't let the negative reviews stop me from going!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at a Villa at the Hawks Cay and I can't tell you how beautiful it was. We have two small children so finding a resort that can accommodate both parents and kids is not always easy.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, hard to swallow price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is located about an hour and a half south of Miami (if memory serves me correctly) which means it is south south south. That is about the only draw-back. It is also about an hour away from Key West if you chose to take a day trip.
reviews.title: DO NOT BOOK AN 'OCEANVIEW' - You may not get one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I had been scouting locations for our wedding in the Keys and just needed some time for "us". Our weekend Hawks Cay was absolutely the perfect choice. We had a whole 2-bedroom townhouse all to ourselves, with a balcony that looked out over the water.
reviews.title: Great Romantic Getaway

likes.disliked: — a little hard to find things - it's a very big property

reviews.text: We also spent a lot of time lounging by the pool, enjoying relaxing music, and having drinks brought to us. My fiance in particular loved the rum bar (he's a big fan of exotic rums) and he said this bar had a lot of hard to find rums. I drink mostly wine, but I really liked that bar too.
reviews.title: We had a great time at Hawks Cay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BEST PART OF THE TRIP: Super laid back vibe. Really quiet and sophisticated. LOTS to do (we snorkeled and parasailed, wish we would have had time to swim with dolphins - would have been very cool.) Way better than all those cheesey side of the road motels all the way up and down the keys. We loved it!
reviews.title: Loved the resort but it is still a work in progress

likes.disliked: — No Room Service or Coffee in Room

reviews.text: My family and I returned from a 5 nights stay at Hawks Cay and loved almost everything about the resort. I traveled with my husband, parents, and my 4 year old daughter. There was something for everyone. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was expenisve but good. The resort grounds and 5 pools were gorgeous! My favorite was the main hotel family pool. The Conch Villa we stayed in was nice and spacious but could have needed some updating. It did not have luxury accommodations as their website described, but the villas were functional and clean with a beautiful water view. I recommend the Island Fish Co. restaurant to eat at. It is located in Marathon, about 10 min. from the resort. The calamari appetizer was great there. Overall, we had a wonderful time and will return next year!!
reviews.title: Spectacular vacation for all !

reviews.text: The resort is lovely and the renovated rooms are truly beautiful. They are still a work in progress but it is easy to see when the work is completed this resort will be a great oasis in the Keys for families, corporate events or a romantic get a way.
reviews.title: Great Time at Hawks Cay

reviews.text: How does one begin to describe the worst vacation ever? My family travels to the Keys twice a year and this was the first time at Hawks Cay and definately the last. Customer service has not been taught to their front desk staff. The food is horrific and there is not much to choose from. If you want to eat past 9:00pm forget it your making a drive to Marathon. The construction is still going strong. The hotel should not be open at all until they are completely finished, especially for the rate they charge per night. All I can say is make the extra drive and stay at the Westin or the Pier House in beautiful Key West. Oh by the way, the rooms do not have a tub for small children. This is clearly not a kid-friendly resort. Try bathing an 8 month old in the bathroom sink. I was so disappointed that I had to write this review. I was very hesitant to book the trip after I read the reviews, now I wish I would have followed my gut instinct.
reviews.title: Don't Even Consider It!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Just recently returned from our trip to Hawks Cay. We have been there several times in the past. New management has ruined the place! The employees that used to be relaxed and smiling, are uptight and skittish. The only restaurant that is open has decent food, but should have gourmet food for the prices that they charge and the service is just down right comical. We also had no linens upon entering our villa. The villa was nice and clean and had a great view. It did need a little upgrading though. While swimming at the pool located behind the Sunset Village Drive side, which was close to our unit, we were asked for hotel identification more than I care to mention. When we stay at a resort, it just doesn't occur to us to constantly remember the little card thing that you receive when you check in, especially when going to a pool right by our villa! People would come to the pool with clipboards. You would have thought that a prisoner had escaped and they were worried about it swimming in their pool.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY

reviews.text: The new pool and fire pit are nice. The hot tub needed cleaning as the water was slimish green.
reviews.title: 3 second review

reviews.text: We went off the resort and ate in town. Can highly recommend the Island or Cabanna Breezes. We found the place that used to be Cabots but is now Frostys to have really fresh fish at great prices.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place. Great Time

reviews.text: If you want to just sit by a big pool, drink expensive drinks and be asked for resort ID, this is the place to go.
reviews.title: No value for the money at this resort
